DataElement.preferredName: Peripheral Neuropathy Mild Adverse Event Present Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a disorder affecting the peripheral nervous system and manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness experienced as a transient event, requiring no special treatment or intervention is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Peripheral Neuropathy Mild Adverse Event Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of a disorder affecting the peripheral nervous system and manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness experienced as a transient event, requiring no special treatment or intervention.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.:A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system.  It is manifested with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness.  It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.

A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.

Property.preferredDefinition: An experience that is usually transient, and requires no special treatment or intervention. The event does not generally interfere with usual daily activities. Includes transient laboratory test alterations. See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: An experience that is usually transient, and requires no special treatment or intervention. The event does not generally interfere with usual daily activities. Includes transient laboratory test alterations.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have peripheral
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have peripheral neuropathy greater than grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have peripheral neuropathy grade 2 or higher?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has neuropathy greater than or equal to grade 2, has patient been evaluated on a case-by-case basis after consultation with the Study Physician?
